judges: Before Schaffer, C. J.; Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson and Parker, JJ.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
We were informed at the oral argument that, to allow sufficient time to prepare the ballots, this ease should be decided by October 5. A majority of the members of the Court agree that the order appealed from should be and it is affirmed. Costs to be paid by appellants.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Carl B. Shelley, with him James W. Reynolds, for appellants.
John W. Murphy, of Gunster, Machie & Murphy, and Raymond T. Law, with them Lawrence F. Casey, Edgar J. Lynett and John J. Sirotnah, for appellees.
E. J. Woodward, Deputy Attorney General, fob Secretary of Commonwealth.
casebody.head_matter:
McLane’s Appeal et al.
Argued September 28,1942.
Before Schaffer, C. J.; Maxey, Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson and Parker, JJ.
Carl B. Shelley, with him James W. Reynolds, for appellants.
John W. Murphy, of Gunster, Machie & Murphy, and Raymond T. Law, with them Lawrence F. Casey, Edgar J. Lynett and John J. Sirotnah, for appellees.
E. J. Woodward, Deputy Attorney General, fob Secretary of Commonwealth.
October 5, 1942:
